Description: Gold plaque from a foundation deposit, with a Greek dotted inscription recording the dedication, in the names of Ptolemy III and Berenike II, of an enclosure sacred to Osiris.
Curator's comments: In a letter to Sir William Hamilton, dated 4th May 1819, Henry Salt states that this plaque was "found over the side column of the gateway, between two singular pieces of coloured earthen ware" (quoted by D. Bailey in a comparative discussion of glass plaques from Canopus).
Bibliographic references: Jewellery / Catalogue of the Jewellery, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum. (2111)
Inscription / The Collection of Ancient Greek Inscriptions in the British Museum (1063)
Bailey 1984a / Glass plaques from a foundation deposit at Canopus, Egypt
Associated names: Named in inscription: Ptolemy III Euergetes I
